title_or_summary: On 2025-03-26, the Employment Insurance Board of Appeal Regulations were published, coming into force with section 634 of the Budget Implementation Act, 2023, No. 1.

title_or_summary: On 2025-03-26, Order 2024-87-24-01 amends the Domestic Substances List under CEPA 1999, applying significant new activity provisions to trixylyl phosphate for risk assessment.
description_or_details: The Chemicals Management Plan (CMP) is a Government of Canada initiative assessing and managing risks from substances. This Order applies the significant new activity (SNAc) provisions of the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999 (CEPA) to phenol, dimethyl-, phosphate (3:1), also known as "trixylyl phosphate." SNAc provisions allow the Minister of the Environment to request information to assess potential environmental and human health risks when a substance is used in a significant new activity. If risks are identified, the Government may recommend mitigation measures. The CMP, launched in 2006, aims to reduce risks posed by substances through assessments conducted by Environment and Health departments under CEPA.
